Question: You need to delete an image with the tag dev/nginx:latest from an Azure container registry named devregistry. </br> Which code segment should you use?

Options.LeftDisplay: az acr repository delete --name devregistry --image dev/nginx:latest
az acr repository delete --name devregistry --suffix dev/nginx:latest
az acr manifest delete --registry devregistry -n dev/nginx:latest
az acr manifest delete --registry devregistry --suffix dev/nginx:latest --image dev/nginx:latest

Question: A company uses Azure Container Instances for an application. </br> You need to ensure that the containers are restarted when the process terminates with a nonzero exit code. </br> What should you do?

Options.LeftDisplay: Define a container restart policy of `Always`.
Run the containers using a managed identity.
Define a container restart policy of Never.

Question: You manage an Azure App Service web app named app1. App1 uses a service plan based on the Basic pricing tier. </br> You need to create a deployment slot for app1. </br> What should you do first?

Options.LeftDisplay: Configure automated deployment of app1 with Azure DevOps.
Configure automated deployment of app1 with GitHub.

Question: You manage a multi-instance deployment of an Azure App Service web app named app1. </br> You need to ensure a client application is routed to the same instance for the life of the session. </br> Which platform setting should you use?

You plan to create an Azure Functions app named app1.
You need to ensure that app1 will satisfy the following requirements:
  • Supports automatic scaling.
  • Has event-based scaling behavior.
  • Provides a serverless pricing model.

Which hosting plan should you use?

A company plans to implement a Microsoft Defender for Cloud solution.
The company has the following requirements:
  • Notifies when DNS domains are not deleted when a new Azure Functions app is deleted.
  • Use native alerting.
  • Minimize costs.

You need to select a hosting plan.
Which hosting plan should you use?
You plan to create a C# script-based Azure Functions app. </br> You need to configure the trigger and bindings for the functions of the Azure Functions app. </br> What should you do?

Options.LeftDisplay: Create a function.json file for each function.
Create a host.json file for the Azure Functions app.
Decorate methods of each function with C# attributes.
Decorate parameters of each function with C# attributes.

Question:
A company plans to create an Azure Functions app.
You need to recommend a solution that meets the following requirements:
  • Executes multiple functions concurrently.
  • Performs aggregation on the results from the functions.
  • Avoids cold starts.
  • Minimizes costs.

Which two components should you recommend? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
You create a batch routine by using a timer trigger in Azure Functions. </br> You need to configure the batch routine to execute every 15 minutes. </br> Which code segment should you use?

Options.LeftDisplay: [FunctionName('TimerTriggerCSharp')] public static void Run([TimerTrigger('0 */15 * * * 1-5')]TimerInfo myTimer, ILogger log) { if (myTimer.IsPastDue) { log.LogInformation('Timer is running late!'); } log.LogInformation($'C# Timer trigger function executed at: {DateTime.Now}'); }

[FunctionName('TimerTriggerCSharp')] public static void Run([TimerTrigger('*/15 * * * 0-4')]TimerInfo myTimer, ILogger log) { if (myTimer.IsPastDue) { log.LogInformation('Timer is running late!'); } log.LogInformation($'C# Timer trigger function executed at: {DateTime.Now}'); }

[FunctionName('TimerTriggerCSharp')] public static void Run([TimerTrigger('0 15 * * * ')]TimerInfo myTimer, ILogger log) { if (myTimer.IsPastDue) { log.LogInformation('Timer is running late!'); } log.LogInformation($'C# Timer trigger function executed at: {DateTime.Now}'); }

[FunctionName('TimerTriggerCSharp')] public static void Run([TimerTrigger('* 15 * * 1-5')]TimerInfo myTimer, ILogger log) { if (myTimer.IsPastDue) { log.LogInformation('Timer is running late!'); } log.LogInformation($'C# Timer trigger function executed at: {DateTime.Now}'); }

Question: You manage the deployment of an Azure Container Registry named registry1 for a company. </br> You need to ensure that registry1 can be shared across multiple groups in the company, enabling group isolation. </br> What should you use?
You need to create a container in a container group and mount an Azure file share as volume. </br> Which code segment should you use?

Options.LeftDisplay: az container create -g MyResourceGroup --name myapp --image myimage:latest --command-line 'cat /mnt/azfile/myfile' --azure-file-volume-share-name myshare --azure-file-volume-account-name mystorageaccount --azure-file-volume-account-key mystoragekey --azure-file-volume-mount-path /mnt/azfile

az container create -g MyResourceGroup --name myapp --image myimage:latest --command-line 'cat /mnt/azfile/myfile' --azure-file-volume-share-name myshare --azure-file-volume-account-name mystorageaccount --azure-file-volume-account-key mystoragekey --secrets-mount-path /mnt/azfile

az container create -g MyResourceGroup –name myapp –image myimage:latest --command-line 'cat /mnt/azfile/myfile' --azure-file-volume-account-name mystorageaccount --azure-file-volume-account-key mystoragekey --azure-file-volume-mount-path /mnt/azfile

az container create -g MyResourceGroup --name myapp --image myimage:latest --command-line 'cat /mnt/azfile/myfile' --azure-file-volume-account-name mystorageaccount --azure-file-volume-account-key mystoragekey --secrets-mount-path /mnt/azfile

Question: You create an Azure web app locally. The web app consists of a ZIP package. </br> You need to deploy the web app by using the Azure CLI. The deployment must reduce the likelihood of locked files. </br> What should you do?

Options.LeftDisplay: Run az webapp deploy specifying --clean true.
Run az webapp deploy specifying --restart true.
Run az webapp deploy to a staging slot with auto swap on.
Run az webapp deploy by using a high value for the --timeout parameter.

Question: You need to configure a web app to allow external requests from https://myapps.com. </br> Which Azure CLI command should you use?

Options.LeftDisplay: az webapp cors add -g MyResourceGroup -n MyWebApp --allowed-origins https://myapps.com
az webapp identity add -g MyResourceGroup -n MyWebApp --allowed-origins https://myapps.com
az webapp traffic-routing set --distribution myapps=100 --name MyWebApp --resource-group MyResourceGroup
az webapp config access-restriction add -g MyResourceGroup -n MyWebApp --rule-name external --action Allow -ids myapps --priority 200

Question: You are developing a .NET application that includes multiple container images. The application will be deployed to Azure Container Instances (ACI). </br. You need to ensure that an Azure file share can be mapped to each container of the application. </br> Which configuration should you use?

You are developing a Linux web app on Azure App Service.
You need to deploy the web app to the production environment based on the following requirements:
  • App changes must be validated in an environment identical to the production environment before moving the app to the production environment.
  • Downtime must be eliminated when the app is deployed to the production environment.

What should you use?

A company has an App Service web app that requires a TLS/SSL certificate. The certificate will be used in other App Service apps. The certificate must be automatically renewed with the least management overhead. </br> You need to add the certificate. </br> What should you do?

Options.LeftDisplay: Create a free App Service managed certificate.
Upload a certificate from a third party.
Import a certificate from a Key Vault.

Question: You are developing an Azure Functions app that will be deployed to a Consumption plan. The app consumes data from a database server that has limited throughput. </br> You need to use the functionAppScaleLimit property to control the number of instances of the app that will be created. </br> Which value should you use for the property setting?

You are developing an Azure Functions app that will be deployed to a Dedicated plan. </br> When there is a resource shortage in the app, it must send a “429 Too Busy” response. </br>You need to apply the appropriate configuration to all functions in a Azure Functions app instance. </br> Which configuration should you set?

Options.LeftDisplay: bindings section in the function.json file

Question: You manage an Azure API Management instance. </br> You need to limit the maximum number of API calls allowed from a single source for a specific time interval. </br> What should you configure?
You plan to use Azure API Management for Hybrid and multicloud API management. </br> You need to create a self-hosted gateway for production. </br> Which container image tag should you use?
You have an Azure event hub. </br> You need to add partitions to the event hub. </br> Which code segment should you use?

Options.LeftDisplay: az eventhubs eventhub consumer-group update --resource-group MyResourceGroupName --namespace-name MyNamespaceName --eventhub-name MyEventHubName --set partitioncount=12
az eventhubs eventhub consumer-group create --resource-group MyResourceGroupName --namespace-name MyNamespaceName --eventhub-name MyEventHubName --set partitioncount=12
az eventhubs eventhub update --resource-group MyResourceGroupName --namespace-name MyNamespaceName --name MyEventHubName --partition-count 12
az eventhubs eventhub create --resource-group MyResourceGroupName --namespace-name MyNamespaceName --name MyEventHubName --partition-count 12

Question: You manage an Azure event hub. </br> You need to ensure that multiple load-balanced instances of a .NET application (version 5.0) can be used to scale event processing. </br> Which event processor client should you use?

You develop this code to read all published events for the first partition in Azure Event Hubs. (Line numbers are included for reference only.) </br> You need to complete the code. </br> Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Options.LeftDisplay: Insert the following code segment at line 6: EventPosition startingPosition = EventPosition.Earliest;
Insert the following code segment at line 6: EventPosition startingPosition = EventPosition.Latest;
Insert the following code segment at line 7: string partitionId = (await consumer.GetPartitionIdsAsync()).First();
Insert the following code segment at line 7: int partitionId = (await consumer.GetPartitionIdsAsync()).First();

Question: You have an instance of Azure Event Grid. </br> You need to ensure an application can receive events filtered by values in the data field in the advanced filtering options. </br> Which filter should you use?
You have an Azure Service Bus instance. </br> You need to provide first-in, first-out (FIFO) guarantee for message processing. </br> What should you configure?

You create an Azure Service Bus topic with a default message time to live of 10 minutes. </br> You need to send messages to this topic with a time to live of 15 minutes. The solution must not affect other applications that are using the topic. </br> What should you recommend?

Options.LeftDisplay: Change the topic's default time to live to 15 minutes.
Change the specific message's time to live to 15 minutes.
Create a new topic with a default time to live of 15 minutes. Send the messages to this topic.
Update the time to live for the queue containing the topic.

Question: You manage an Azure Cosmos DB database named database1. </br> You need to read items from the database without any ordering guarantee and ensure the highest availability. </br> Which consistency level should you use?

You manage an Azure Cosmos DB container named container1. </br> You need to use the ReadItemAsync method to read an item from the Azure Cosmos service. </br> Which two parameters do you need to provide? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

You have an application that writes data to Azure Cosmos DB. </br> The application must offer consistent prefix and monotonic reads. </br> You need to configure the consistency level. </br> Which consistency level should you use?

You plan to implement a storage mechanism for managing state across multiple change feed consumers. </br> You need to configure the change feed processor in the .NET SDK for Azure Cosmos DB for NoSQL API. </br> Which component should you use?

You have blobs in Azure Blob storage. The blobs store pictures. </br> You need to record the location and weather condition information from when the pictures were taken. You must ensure you can use up to 2,000 characters when recording the information. </br> What should you do?

Options.LeftDisplay: Append a suffix to the blob name by using the location and weather. Add a delimiter between them.
Use metadata headers defined with a POST request.
Use metadata headers defined with a PUT request.
Create one container for each location. Inside each container, define the blob name as the weather type and a random suffix.

Question: You have an Azure storage lifecycle policy for block blobs. </br> You need to create a prefixMatch filter rule that will contain an array of strings for prefixes to be matched. </br> What should be the first element of the prefix string?

You create this retention policy. (Line numbers are included for reference only.) </br> You need to transition blobs in the Hot access tier to an online tier if the blobs have not been modified in over 90 days. </br> Which code segment should you add to line 14?

A company implements a multi-region Azure Cosmos DB account. </br> You need to configure the default consistency level for the account. The consistency level must ensure that update operations made as a batch within a transaction are always visible together. </br> Which consistency level should you use?

A company implements an Azure Cosmos DB account named Account1 to store product details. </br> You need to write a parameterized SQL query to get items from the Products container based on category and price as parameters. </br> Which SQL query should you write?

Options.LeftDisplay: SELECT * FROM Products p WHERE p.category = @Category AND p.price = @Price
SELECT * FROM Account1 a WHERE a.category = @Category AND a.price = @Price
SELECT * FROM Account1.Products p WHERE p.category = @Category AND p.price = @Price
SELECT * FROM Products p WHERE p.category = 'Category' AND p.price = 'Price'

Question: You are developing an application. </br> You need to set the standard HTTP properties of containers in Azure Blob Storage. </br> Which two HTTP properties can you set? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

You manage Azure Cache for Redis by using classes in the .NET StackExchange.Redis namespace. </br> You need to retrieve a reference to a Redis database by using the GetDatabase method. </br> What do you need to do first?

You deploy a .NET web application to an on-premises web server. You plan to use Application Insights to monitor the web application's performance. </br> You need to allow the web application to upload its telemetry to Application Insights. </br> Which authorization method should you use?

You develop an Azure function that connects to a SQL database. The function is instrumented by using Application Insights. </br> You need to view the full SQL query text when inspecting the Dependency tab in Application Insights. </br> Which two settings in the host.json file should you use? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

You have an Azure web application. </br> You need to configure an application performance management (APM) service to collect and monitor the application log data. </br> Which Azure service should you configure?
You need to track the availability of an Azure App Service web app by using an Application Insights multi-step availability test. </br> Which tool should you use?
You need to capture user actions by using the Azure Application Insights API. </br> Which API call should you use?

You plan to develop a web job that performs calculations on top of data that is collected from users. </br> You need to send pre-aggregated summary metrics to Azure Monitor. </br> Which Application Insights method should you use?
You have an Application Insights instance named insight1. </br> You need to configure a web app to send telemetry data to insight1. </br> Which Application Insights parameter should you use?
You have an Azure Storage account. </br> You need to provide external users the ability to create and update blobs. </br> Which enum value of BlobSasPermissions should you use?

You develop an application. The application will be accessed by a supplier. </br> The supplier requires a shared access signature (SAS) to access Azure services in your company's subscription. </br> You need to secure the SAS. </br> Which three actions should you take? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

Options.LeftDisplay: Use Azure Monitor and Azure Storage logs to monitor the application.
Define a stored access policy for a service SAS.

Question: You manage a Microsoft Entra ID registered application named app1. App1 calls a web API, which then calls Microsoft Graph. </br> You need to ensure the signed-in user identity is delegated through the request chain. </br> Which authentication flow should you use?
You plan to generate a shared access signature (SAS) token for read access to a blob in a storage account. </br> You need to secure the token from being compromised. </br> What should you use?

Options.LeftDisplay: Microsoft Entra ID credentials assigned the Contributor role
Microsoft Entra ID credentials assigned the Reader role

Question: You need to generate a shared access signature token that grants the Read permission to a blob container. </br> Which code segment should you use?

Options.LeftDisplay: BlobSasBuilder sasBuilder = new BlobSasBuilder() { BlobContainerName = containerClient.Name, Resource = 'b' }; sasBuilder.ExpiresOn = DateTimeOffset.UtcNow.AddHours(1); sasBuilder.SetPermissions(BlobContainerSasPermissions.Read); Uri sasUri = containerClient.GenerateSasUri(sasBuilder);

BlobSasBuilder sasBuilder = new BlobSasBuilder() { BlobContainerName = containerClient.Name, Resource = 'c' }; sasBuilder.ExpiresOn = DateTimeOffset.UtcNow.AddHours(1); sasBuilder.SetPermissions(BlobContainerSasPermissions.Read); Uri sasUri = containerClient.GenerateSasUri(sasBuilder);

BlobSasBuilder sasBuilder = new BlobSasBuilder() { BlobContainerName = containerClient.Name, Resource = 'c' }; sasBuilder.ExpiresOn = DateTimeOffset.UtcNow.AddHours(1); sasBuilder.SetPermissions(BlobContainerSasPermissions.Create); Uri sasUri = containerClient.GenerateSasUri(sasBuilder);

BlobSasBuilder sasBuilder = new BlobSasBuilder() { BlobContainerName = containerClient.Name, Resource = 'b' }; sasBuilder.ExpiresOn = DateTimeOffset.UtcNow.AddHours(1); sasBuilder.SetPermissions(BlobContainerSasPermissions.Create); Uri sasUri = containerClient.GenerateSasUri(sasBuilder);

Question:
You plan to enable a user to create a managed identity for an Azure virtual machine (VM).
You need to ensure the following requirements are met:
  • The user account must have sufficient permissions to create the managed identity.

The principle of least privilege must be used.
Which permission role should you assign?

You have 10 applications running in Azure App Service. </br> You need to ensure the applications have access to items stored in Azure App Configuration by using a common configuration. Passwords or keys must not be used. </br> Which solution should you use?

Options.LeftDisplay: service principal with permissions to Azure App Configuration

Question: You need to group keys in Azure App Configuration. </br> What are two possible ways to achieve this goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

Options.LeftDisplay: Use Azure role-based access control. Grant the Read permission to read keys that belong to the application.
Organize keys by using key prefixes.
Use managed identity. Grant the Read permission to read keys that belong to the application.

Question: You manage an Azure App Service web app named app1 and an Azure Key Vault named vault1. </br> You need to ensure app1 can authenticate and conduct operations with vault1 without managing the rotation of a secret. </br> Which authentication method should you use for app1?

You have an Azure App Configuration instance named AppConfig1 and an Azure key vault named KeyVault1. </br> You plan to encrypt data stored in AppConfig1 by using your own key stored in KeyVault1. </br> You need to grant permissions in KeyVault1 to the identity assigned to AppConfig1. </br> Which three key-specific permissions should you use? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

You are developing a solution that stores secrets in an Azure Key Vault named myvault. </br> You need to retrieve the value for a secret named mysecret that is stored in myvault. </br> Which CLI command should you use?

Options.LeftDisplay: az keyvault secret recover --name mysecret --vault-name myvault
az keyvault secret show --name mysecret --vault-name myvault

Question: You manage the staging and production deployment slots of an Azure App Service web app named app1. </br> You need to ensure a connection string is not swapped when swapping is performed. </br> Which configuration should you use?

A container group in Azure Container Instances has multiple containers. </br> The containers must restart when the process executed in the container group terminates due to an error. </br> You need to define the restart policy for the container group. </br> Which Azure CLI command should you use?

Options.LeftDisplay: az container create --resource-group myResourceGroup --name mycontainer --image mycontainerimage --restart-policy Always
az container create --resource-group myResourceGroup --name mycontainer --image mycontainerimage --restart-policy Never
az container create --resource-group myResourceGroup --name mycontainer --image mycontainerimage --restart-policy OnFailure

Question:
You are developing a cloud native containerized background task application.
You need to choose the appropriate container deployment option based on the following requirements:
  • Minimize cost
  • Support service discovery and traffic splitting
  • Enable event-driven application architecture
  • Do not require access to native Kubernetes API

What should you use?
You need to read an Azure Cosmos DB change feed by using a reactive model. What are two possible ways to achieve this goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.</br>

Options.LeftDisplay: Azure Functions with an Azure Cosmos DB trigger
Azure Functions with an Azure Event Grid trigger

Question: You need to implement an Azure Storage lifecycle policy for append blobs. </br> Which rule action should you use?

A company plans to host a static website that uses a custom domain and Azure Storage in multiple regions. </br> You need to serve website content and minimize latency. </br> What are two possible ways to achieve this goal? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

Options.LeftDisplay: Upload static content to a storage container named **$web.**
Use Azure Traffic Manager to route users to the closest region.
Upload static content to a storage container named **web.**
Use Azure Content Delivery Network for regional caching.

Question: You need to set a duration of 10 seconds for a key stored in Azure Cache for Redis. </br> Which code segment should you use?

Options.LeftDisplay: using (var cache = ConnectionMultiplexer.Connect('')) { IDatabase db = cache.GetDatabase(); bool setValue = await db.StringSetAsync('test:key', '10'); }
using (var cache = ConnectionMultiplexer.Connect('')) { IDatabase db = cache.GetDatabase(); bool setValue = await db.StringSetAsync('test:key', '10', TimeSpan.FromSeconds(10)); }
using (var cache = ConnectionMultiplexer.Connect('')) { IDatabase db = cache.GetDatabase(); bool setValue = await db.StringSetAsync('test:key', '10', DateTime.UtcNow.AddSeconds(10)); }
using (var cache = ConnectionMultiplexer.Connect('')) { IDatabase db = cache.GetDatabase(); bool setValue = await db.StringSetAsync('test:key', '10', DateTime.Now.AddSeconds(10)); }

Question: You manage an Azure Cache for Redis instance. </br> You need to load data on demand into the cache from a large database. </br> Which application architecture pattern should you use?

You have an Azure Cache for Redis instance.
You have the following requirements:
  • Replica nodes must be hosted in different availability zones.
  • Nonvolatile memory must be used.

You need to select a pricing tier.
Which pricing tier should you use?

A company uses Application Insights to instrument an application hosted in Azure App Service. </br> Instrumentation data that is collected by using API calls in the code is not available in Application Insights. </br> You need to ensure the collected data is available in Application Insights. </br> What should you do?

Options.LeftDisplay: Verify the health of Application Insights.
Verify the health of Azure App Service.

Question: You plan to use a shared access signature to protect access to services within a general-purpose v2 storage account. </br> You need to identify the type of service that you can protect by using the user delegation shared access signature. </br> Which service should you identify?
You plan to create a key namespace hierarchy in Azure App Configuration. </br> You need to separate individual key names. </br> Which character should you use?
You need to generate a new version of a key stored in Azure Key Vault. </br> Which code segment should you use?

Options.LeftDisplay: az keyvault key rotation-policy update -n mykey --vault-name mykeyvault --value path/to/policy.json
az keyvault key purge --name mykey --vault-name mykeyvault
az keyvault key rotate --vault-name mykeyvault --name mykey
az keyvault key set-attributes --vault-name mykeyvault --name mykey –policy path/to/policy.json

Question:
You have an Azure Storage account container named container1.
You need to configure access to the container to meet the following requirements:
  • The shared access signature (SAS) token should be secured with Microsoft Entra ID credentials.
  • Role-based access control (RBAC) should be used.
  • The SAS token should support granting access to containers.

Which type of SAS should you use?
You need to capture events streaming from Azure Event Hubs. </br> To which three locations can you capture data? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

You have an Azure Service Bus queue. </br> You need to ensure a publisher can send messages into a topic and multiple subscribers can become eligible to consume the messages. </br> Which message routing pattern should you use?

You are developing a .NET project that will manage messages in Azure Storage queues. </br> You need to verify the presence of messages in a queue without removing them from the queue. </br> Which method should you use?

You have an application that requires message queuing.
You need to recommend a solution that meets the following requirements:
  • automatic duplicate message detection.
  • ability to send 2 MB messages.

Which message queuing solution should you recommend?

Options.LeftDisplay: Azure Storage queues with locally redundant storage (LRS)
Azure Storage queues with zone-redundant storage (ZRS)

Question: A company plans to use Azure Cache for Redis. The company plans to use Redis modules. </br> You need to recommend an Azure Cache for Redis service tier. </br> Which service tier should you recommend?

You plan to use Azure Cache for Redis as the caching layer for several applications.
You have the following requirements:
  • Prevent data loss if nodes are down.
  • Minimize storage costs.
  • Optimize performance.

Which solution should you use?

Options.LeftDisplay: Redis database (RDB) persistence with the soft-delete feature enabled on the associated storage account.
Redis database (RDB) persistence with the soft-delete feature disabled on the associated storage account.
Append only File (AOF) persistence with the soft-delete feature disabled on the associated storage account.
Append only File (AOF) persistence with the soft-delete feature enabled on the associated storage account.

Question: You have this GameStat class. </br> You need to store an instance of the GameStat class in Azure Cache for Redis. </br> Which two code segments should you use? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

Options.LeftDisplay: var stat = new GameStat('Soccer', new DateTime(2019, 7, 16), 'Local Game', new[] { 'Team 1', 'Team 2' }, new[] { ('Team 1', 2), ('Team 2', 1) }); string serializedValue = System.Text.Json.JsonSerializer.Serialize (stat); bool added = db.StringSet('event:1950-world-cup', serializedValue);

var stat = new GameStat('Soccer', new DateTime(2019, 7, 16), 'Local Game', new[] { 'Team 1', 'Team 2' }, new[] { ('Team 1', 2), ('Team 2', 1) }); bool added = db.StringSet('event:1950-world-cup', stat.ToString());

var stat = new GameStat('Soccer', new DateTime(2019, 7, 16), 'Local Game', new[] { 'Team 1', 'Team 2' }, new[] { ('Team 1', 2), ('Team 2', 1) }); string serializedValue = System.Text.Json.JsonSerializer.Serialize (stat); bool added = db. StringGet ('event:1950-world-cup', serializedValue);

var stat = new GameStat('Soccer', new DateTime(2019, 7, 16), 'Local Game', new[] { 'Team 1', 'Team 2' }, new[] { ('Team 1', 2), ('Team 2', 1) }); bool added = db.StringGet('event:1950-world-cup', stat.ToString());

Question:
You plan to use Application Insights to monitor the performance of an on-premises web application.

App1 will have multiple application objects and a single service principal.

Question:

You have the following requirements:
  • App1 should access account1 without managing credentials.
  • The service principal associated with app1 cannot be explicitly deleted.

You need to configure a security principal for app1.
Which security principal should you use?

You develop a web application hosted on the Web Apps feature of Microsoft Azure App Service. </br> You need to enable and configure Azure Web Service Local Cache with 1.5 GB. </br> Which two code segments should you use? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
You have an Azure Key Vault named MyVault. </br> You need to use a key vault reference to access a secret named MyConnection from MyVault. </br> Which code segment should you use?

You develop an App Service app hosted on Windows Platform. Users report that the app is failing. </br> You need to begin troubleshooting the app by inspecting a copy of the page that is returned when the HTTP return code is greater than 400. </br> Which type of log should you review?

You manage the deployment of an Azure Cosmos DB account. </br> You must define custom logic by using the .NET SDK change feed processor to process changes that the change feed reads. </br> You need to select the appropriate change feed processor component. </br> Which component should you use?

You are planning to host a static website in an Azure Storage account. </br> The website must be accessible only through HTTPS by using a custom domain name. </br> You enable the static website hosting feature. Question: You manage APIs in production by using Azure API Management. </br> You need to remove X-Powered-By and X-AspNet-Version headers from a response. </br> Which code segment should you use?
You manage an instance of Azure API Management. You define policies to multiple scopes. </br> You need to enforce a policy evaluation order. </br> What should you use?
You need to write a filter condition for an Azure Service Bus topic. </br> Which three filters can you use? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
